citation.article-title: Deoxyribonucleic acid relatedness between serogroups and serovars in the family Leptospiroceae with proposals for seven new Leptospira species.

p.s: Description of Leptospira weilii sp. nov.

Leptospira weilii (weil' i. i. N.L. gen. n. weilii to honor Adolph Weil, the German physician who was among the first to clinically differentiate leptospirosis [Weil's disease] from other types of infectious
Leptospira weilii does not grow at 11 or 37°C, and its growth is inhibited by 8-azaguanine (225 μg/ml), 2,6-diaminopurine (10 μg/ml), and copper sulfate (100 ppm).
It contains serovars from serogroups Celledoni and Icterohaemorrhagiae (subserogroup Sarmin).
The type strain, strain Celledoni (= ATCC 43285), is a member of serogroup Celledoni and serovar celledoni and was isolated from the blood of a patient in North Queensland, Australia, by D.
Smith et al. (22); it has a G+C content of 40.5 ± 0.7 mol%.
